title: Paul Boyle (rugby union)
text:
Paul Boyle (born 14 January 1997) is an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> and <a href="European%20Rugby%20Challenge%20Cup">European Rugby Challenge Cup</a> side <a href="Connacht%20Rugby">Connacht</a>. He can play across the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Back%20row%20%28Loose%20forwards%29">back-row</a>.
Early life.
Boyle was born in Dublin South.
He first began playing rugby at age 7 with <a href="Gorey%20RFC">Gorey RFC</a>.
Boyle came through the underage ranks for <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> and was a member of their sub-academy, whilst also playing club rugby with <a href="Lansdowne%20Football%20Club">Lansdowne</a> in the <a href="All-Ireland%20League%20%28rugby%20union%29">All-Ireland League</a>, but was never offered a place in Leinster’s full academy.
Professional.
Boyle joined Connacht's academy ahead of the 2017–18 season. He made his senior Connacht debut in January 2018 against provincial rivals <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a>. Boyle's performances for Connacht during the early months of the 2018–19 season saw him rewarded with his first professional contract with the province, which led to him graduating from year two of the academy and join the senior squad until at least June 2021.
Ireland.
Boyle captained <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland under-20s</a> at the <a href="2017%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2017 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a>, where they finished ninth overall. In June 2021 he was called up to the senior <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> squad for the Summer tests. Boyle made his debut off the bench for the Ireland senior side, in a 71–10 victory over the United States on 10 July 2021.
